You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

### Python

```python
### maxDistance 
from collections import deque   # --- py stmt 1
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 2
def f_gold(grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:   # --- py stmt 3
    n = len(grid)   # --- py stmt 4
    q = deque([(i, j) for i in range(n) for j in range(n) if grid[i][j] == 1])   # --- py stmt 5
    ans = -1   # --- py stmt 6
    valid = False   # --- py stmt 7
    while q:   # --- py stmt 8
        ans += 1   # --- py stmt 9
        for _ in range(len(q)):   # --- py stmt 10
            i, j = q.popleft()   # --- py stmt 11
            for a, b in [[0, 1], [0, -1], [1, 0], [-1, 0]]:   # --- py stmt 12
                x, y = i + a, b + j   # --- py stmt 13
                if 0 <= x < n and 0 <= y < n and grid[x][y] == 0:   # --- py stmt 14
                    valid = True   # --- py stmt 15
                    grid[x][y] = 1   # --- py stmt 16
                    q.append((x, y))   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans if valid else -1   # --- py stmt 18
### nearestExit 
from collections import deque   # --- py stmt 19
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 20
def f_gold(maze: List[List[str]], entrance: List[int]) -> int:   # --- py stmt 21
    m, n = len(maze), len(maze[0])   # --- py stmt 22
    i, j = entrance   # --- py stmt 23
    q = deque([(i, j)])   # --- py stmt 24
    maze[i][j] = '+'   # --- py stmt 25
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 26
    while q:   # --- py stmt 27
        ans += 1   # --- py stmt 28
        for _ in range(len(q)):   # --- py stmt 29
            i, j = q.popleft()   # --- py stmt 30
            for a, b in [[0, -1], [0, 1], [-1, 0], [1, 0]]:   # --- py stmt 31
                x, y = i + a, j + b   # --- py stmt 32
                if 0 <= x < m and 0 <= y < n and maze[x][y] == '.':   # --- py stmt 33
                    if x == 0 or x == m - 1 or y == 0 or y == n - 1:   # --- py stmt 34
                        return ans   # --- py stmt 35
                    q.append((x, y))   # --- py stmt 36
                    maze[x][y] = '+'   # --- py stmt 37
    return -1   # --- py stmt 38
### maximumsSplicedArray 
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 39
def f_gold(nums1: List[int], nums2: List[int]) -> int:   # --- py stmt 40
    def f(nums1, nums2):   # --- py stmt 41
        d = [a - b for a, b in zip(nums1, nums2)]   # --- py stmt 42
        t = mx = d[0]   # --- py stmt 43
        for v in d[1:]:   # --- py stmt 44
            if t > 0:   # --- py stmt 45
                t += v   # --- py stmt 46
            else:   # --- py stmt 47
                t = v   # --- py stmt 48
            mx = max(mx, t)   # --- py stmt 49
        return mx   # --- py stmt 50
    s1, s2 = sum(nums1), sum(nums2)   # --- py stmt 51
    return max(s2 + f(nums1, nums2), s1 + f(nums2, nums1))   # --- py stmt 52
```

### JavaScript

```javascript

function f_gold (grid) {   // --- py stmt 3
    var n = grid.length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var q = [];   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {   // --- py stmt 5
        for (var j = 0; j < n; j++) {   // --- py stmt 5
            if (grid[i][j] == 1) {   // --- py stmt 5
                q.push([i, j]);   // --- py stmt 5
            }
        }
    }
    var ans = -1;   // --- py stmt 6
    var valid = false;   // --- py stmt 7
    while (q.length > 0) {   // --- py stmt 8
        ans += 1;   // --- py stmt 9
        for (var _ = 0; _ < q.length; _++) {   // --- py stmt 10
            var i = q[0][0];   // --- py stmt 11
            var j = q[0][1];   // --- py stmt 11
            q.shift();   // --- py stmt 11
            for (var a = 0; a < 2; a++) {   // --- py stmt 12
                for (var b = 0; b < 2; b++) {   // --- py stmt 12
                    var x = i + a;   // --- py stmt 13
                    var y = b + j;   // --- py stmt 13
                    if (0 <= x < n && 0 <= y < n && grid[x][y] == 0) {   // --- py stmt 14
                        valid = true;   // --- py stmt 15
                        grid[x][y] = 1;   // --- py stmt 16
                        q.push([x, y]);   // --- py stmt 17
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return valid ? ans : -1;   // --- py stmt 18
}



function f_gold ( maze, entrance ) {   // --- py stmt 21
    var m = maze.length;   // --- py stmt 22
    var n = maze[0].length;   // --- py stmt 22
    var i = entrance[0];   // --- py stmt 23
    var j = entrance[1];   // --- py stmt 23
    var q = [ [ i, j ] ];   // --- py stmt 24
    maze[i][j] = '+';   // --- py stmt 25
    var ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 26
    while ( q.length > 0 ) {   // --- py stmt 27
        ans += 1;   // --- py stmt 28
        for ( var _ = 0; _ < q.length; _++ ) {   // --- py stmt 29
            i = q.shift()[0];   // --- py stmt 30
            j = q.shift()[1];   // --- py stmt 30
            for ( var a = 0; a < 2; a++ ) {   // --- py stmt 31
                for ( var b = 0; b < 2; b++ ) {   // --- py stmt 31
                    var x = i + a;   // --- py stmt 32
                    var y = j + b;   // --- py stmt 32
                    if ( x >= 0 && x < m && y >= 0 && y < n && maze[x][y] == '.' ) {   // --- py stmt 33
                        if ( x == 0 || x == m - 1 || y == 0 || y == n - 1 ) {   // --- py stmt 34
                            return ans;   // --- py stmt 35
                        }
                        q.push( [ x, y ] );   // --- py stmt 36
                        maze[x][y] = '+';   // --- py stmt 37
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return -1;   // --- py stmt 38
}



function f_gold(nums1, nums2) {   // --- py stmt 40
    function f(nums1, nums2) {   // --- py stmt 41
        var d = [a - b for a, b in zip(nums1, nums2)];   // --- py stmt 42
        var t = mx = d[0];   // --- py stmt 43
        for (var v in d[1:]) {   // --- py stmt 44
            if (t > 0) {   // --- py stmt 45
                t += v;   // --- py stmt 46
            }
            else {   // --- py stmt 47
                t = v;   // --- py stmt 48
            }
            mx = max(mx, t);   // --- py stmt 49
        }
        return mx;   // --- py stmt 50
    }
    var s1, s2 = sum(nums1), sum(nums2);   // --- py stmt 51
    return max(s2 + f(nums1, nums2), s1 + f(nums2, nums1));   // --- py stmt 52
}


```
